Package org.radarbase.management.web.rest

Class AccountResource

java.lang.Object
org.radarbase.management.web.rest.AccountResource
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class AccountResource extends Object
REST controller for managing the current user's account.

  • Method Details

    • activateAccount

      @GetMapping("/activate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> activateAccount(@RequestParam("key") String key)
      GET /activate : activate the registered user.
      Parameters:
      key - the activation key
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and the activated user in body, or status 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be activated

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public UserDTO login(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session) throws org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException
      POST /login : check if the user is authenticated.
      Parameters:
      session - the HTTP session
      Returns:
      user account details if the user is authenticated
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException

    • logout

      @PostMapping("/logout") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> logout(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      POST /logout : log out.
      Parameters:
      request - the HTTP request
      Returns:
      no content response if the user is authenticated

    • getAccount

      @GetMapping("/account") public UserDTO getAccount()
      GET /account : get the current user.
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and the current user in body, or status 401 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be returned

    • saveAccount

      @PostMapping("/account") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> saveAccount(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserDTO userDto, org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication) throws org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException
      POST /account : update the current user information.
      Parameters:
      userDto - the current user information
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK), or status 400 (Bad Request) or 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be updated
      Throws:
      org.radarbase.management.security.NotAuthorizedException

    • changePassword

      @PostMapping(path="/account/change_password", produces="text/plain") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> changePassword(@RequestBody String password)
      POST /account/change_password : changes the current user's password.
      Parameters:
      password - the new password
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK), or status 400 (Bad Request) if the new password is not strong enough

    • requestActivationReset

      @PostMapping(path="/account/reset-activation/init") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> requestActivationReset(@RequestBody String login)
      POST /account/reset-activation/init : Resend the password activation email to the user.
      Parameters:
      login - the login of the user
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the email was sent, or status 400 (Bad Request) if the email address is not registered or user is not deactivated

    • requestPasswordReset

      @PostMapping(path="/account/reset_password/init") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> requestPasswordReset(@RequestBody String mail)
      POST /account/reset_password/init : Email the user a password reset link.
      Parameters:
      mail - the mail of the user
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the email was sent, or status 400 (Bad Request) if the email address is not registered

    • finishPasswordReset

      @PostMapping(path="/account/reset_password/finish", produces="text/plain") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> finishPasswordReset(@RequestBody KeyAndPasswordVM keyAndPassword)
      POST /account/reset_password/finish : Finish to reset the password of the user.
      Parameters:
      keyAndPassword - the generated key and the new password
      Returns:
      the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the password has been reset, or status 400 (Bad Request) or 500 (Internal Server Error) if the password could not be reset
